sentence1: At the time when the Tang dynasty reigned over the Middle Kingdom, there were master swordsmen of various kinds.
sentence2: They were able to take different shapes at will, and their swords were like strokes of lightning.

sentence1: They were able to take different shapes at will, and their swords were like strokes of lightning.
sentence2: Before their opponents knew they had been struck their heads had already fallen.

sentence1: Before their opponents knew they had been struck their heads had already fallen.
sentence2: Yet these master swordsmen were men of lofty mind, and did not lightly mingle in the quarrels of the world.

sentence1: Yet these master swordsmen were men of lofty mind, and did not lightly mingle in the quarrels of the world.
sentence2: It was their custom to slay the unjust, and to come to the aid of the oppressed.

sentence1: It was their custom to slay the unjust, and to come to the aid of the oppressed.
sentence2: They wore a hidden dagger at their side and carried a leather bag at their belt.

sentence1: They wore a hidden dagger at their side and carried a leather bag at their belt.
sentence2: By magic means they were able to turn human heads into flowing water.

sentence1: By magic means they were able to turn human heads into flowing water.
sentence2: They could fly over roofs and walk up and down walls, and they came and went and left no trace.

sentence1: They could fly over roofs and walk up and down walls, and they came and went and left no trace.
sentence2: They hired themselves out to those who wished to do away with their enemies.

sentence1: They hired themselves out to those who wished to do away with their enemies.
sentence2: Molo, however, of whom this story tells, was a sword hero.

sentence1: Molo, however, of whom this story tells, was a sword hero.
sentence2: At that time there lived a young man named Tsui, whose father was a high official and the friend of the prince.

sentence1: At that time there lived a young man named Tsui, whose father was a high official and the friend of the prince.
sentence2: And the father once sent his son to visit his princely friend, who was ill.

sentence1: And the father once sent his son to visit his princely friend, who was ill.
sentence2: When he entered the prince's palace, there stood three beautiful slave girls, who piled rosy peaches into a golden bowl, poured sugar over them and presented them to him.

sentence1: When he entered the prince's palace, there stood three beautiful slave girls, who piled rosy peaches into a golden bowl, poured sugar over them and presented them to him.
sentence2: After he had eaten he took his leave, and his princely host ordered one of the slave girls, Rose-Red by name, to escort him to the gate.

sentence1: After he had eaten he took his leave, and his princely host ordered one of the slave girls, Rose-Red by name, to escort him to the gate.
sentence2: As they went along the young man kept looking back at her.

sentence1: As they went along the young man kept looking back at her.
sentence2: And she smiled at him and made signs with her fingers.

sentence1: And she smiled at him and made signs with her fingers.
sentence2: First she would stretch out three fingers, then she would turn her hand around three times, and finally she would point to a little mirror which she wore on her breast.

sentence1: First she would stretch out three fingers, then she would turn her hand around three times, and finally she would point to a little mirror which she wore on her breast.
sentence2: When they parted she whispered to him: "Do not forget me!"

sentence1: When they parted she whispered to him: "Do not forget me!"
sentence2: Now it happened that he had an old servant named Molo, who was an extraordinary being.

sentence1: Now it happened that he had an old servant named Molo, who was an extraordinary being.
sentence2: "What is the trouble, master," said he.

sentence1: "What is the trouble, master," said he.
sentence2: Do you not want to tell your old slave about it?"

sentence1: Do you not want to tell your old slave about it?"
sentence2: So the boy told him what had occurred, and also mentioned the signs the girl had made to him in secret.

sentence1: So the boy told him what had occurred, and also mentioned the signs the girl had made to him in secret.
sentence2: When she turned round her hand three times, it meant the sum of three times five fingers, which is fifteen.

sentence1: When she turned round her hand three times, it meant the sum of three times five fingers, which is fifteen.
sentence2: When she pointed at the little mirror, she meant to say that on the fifteenth, when the moon is round as a mirror, at midnight, you are to go for her."

sentence1: When she pointed at the little mirror, she meant to say that on the fifteenth, when the moon is round as a mirror, at midnight, you are to go for her."
sentence2: Then the young man was roused from his confused thoughts, and was so happy he could hardly control himself.

sentence1: Then the young man was roused from his confused thoughts, and was so happy he could hardly control himself.
sentence2: But soon he grew sad again and said: "The prince's palace is shut off as though by an ocean.

sentence1: But soon he grew sad again and said: "The prince's palace is shut off as though by an ocean.
sentence2: "Nothing easier," said Molo.

sentence1: "Nothing easier," said Molo.
sentence2: "On the fifteenth we will take two pieces of dark silk and wrap ourselves up in them, and thus I will carry you there.

sentence1: "On the fifteenth we will take two pieces of dark silk and wrap ourselves up in them, and thus I will carry you there.
sentence2: No one can pass by him, so he must be killed."

sentence1: No one can pass by him, so he must be killed."
sentence2: When the appointed day had come, the servant said: "There is no one else in the world who can kill this dog but myself!"

sentence1: When the appointed day had come, the servant said: "There is no one else in the world who can kill this dog but myself!"
sentence2: Full of joy the youth gave him meat and wine, and the old man took a chain-hammer and disappeared with it.

sentence1: Full of joy the youth gave him meat and wine, and the old man took a chain-hammer and disappeared with it.
sentence2: And after no more time had elapsed than it takes to eat a meal he was back again and said: "The dog is dead, and there is nothing further to hinder us!"

sentence1: And after no more time had elapsed than it takes to eat a meal he was back again and said: "The dog is dead, and there is nothing further to hinder us!"
sentence2: At midnight they wrapped themselves in dark silk, and the old man carried the youth over the tenfold walls which surrounded the palace.

sentence1: At midnight they wrapped themselves in dark silk, and the old man carried the youth over the tenfold walls which surrounded the palace.
sentence2: Then they saw the glow of a little lamp, and heard Rose-Red sigh deeply.

sentence1: Then they saw the glow of a little lamp, and heard Rose-Red sigh deeply.
sentence2: The youth raised the curtain and stepped into the room.

sentence1: The youth raised the curtain and stepped into the room.
sentence2: Long and searchingly Rose-Red looked at him, then seized his hand.

sentence1: Long and searchingly Rose-Red looked at him, then seized his hand.
sentence2: "I knew that you were intelligent, and would understand my sign language.

sentence1: "I knew that you were intelligent, and would understand my sign language.
sentence2: But what magic power have you at your disposal, that you were able to get here?"

sentence1: But what magic power have you at your disposal, that you were able to get here?"
sentence2: The youth told her in detail how Molo had helped him.

sentence1: The youth told her in detail how Molo had helped him.
sentence2: Then she called him in and gave him wine to drink from a jade goblet and said: "I am of good family and have come here from far away.

sentence1: Then she called him in and gave him wine to drink from a jade goblet and said: "I am of good family and have come here from far away.
sentence2: Force alone has made me a slave in this palace.

sentence1: Force alone has made me a slave in this palace.
sentence2: Dear Molo, you are endowed with magic powers.

sentence1: Dear Molo, you are endowed with magic powers.
sentence2: I beg you to save me in my distress!

sentence1: I beg you to save me in my distress!
sentence2: If you do, I will be glad to serve your master as a slave, and will never forget the favor you do me."

sentence1: If you do, I will be glad to serve your master as a slave, and will never forget the favor you do me."
sentence2: The youth looked at Molo.

sentence1: The youth looked at Molo.
sentence2: First he asked permission to carry away Rose-Red's gear and jewels in sacks and bags.

sentence1: First he asked permission to carry away Rose-Red's gear and jewels in sacks and bags.
sentence2: Three times he went away and returned until he had finished.

sentence1: Three times he went away and returned until he had finished.
sentence2: Then he took his master and Rose-Red upon his back, and flew away with them over the steep walls.

sentence1: Then he took his master and Rose-Red upon his back, and flew away with them over the steep walls.
sentence2: None of the watchmen of the prince's palace noticed anything out of the way.

sentence1: None of the watchmen of the prince's palace noticed anything out of the way.
sentence2: At home the youth hid Rose-Red in a distant room.

sentence1: At home the youth hid Rose-Red in a distant room.
sentence2: When the prince discovered that one of his slave-girls was missing, and that one of his wild dogs had been killed, he said: "That must have been some powerful sword hero!"

sentence1: When the prince discovered that one of his slave-girls was missing, and that one of his wild dogs had been killed, he said: "That must have been some powerful sword hero!"
sentence2: And he gave strict orders that the matter should not be mentioned, and that investigations should be made in secret.

sentence1: And he gave strict orders that the matter should not be mentioned, and that investigations should be made in secret.
sentence2: Hence, when the flowers began to bloom in the spring, Rose-Red went driving in a small wagon outside the city, near the river.

sentence1: Hence, when the flowers began to bloom in the spring, Rose-Red went driving in a small wagon outside the city, near the river.
sentence2: And there one of the prince's servants saw her, and informed his master.

sentence1: And there one of the prince's servants saw her, and informed his master.
sentence2: The latter sent for the youth, who, since he could not conceal the matter, told him the whole story exactly as it had happened.

sentence1: The latter sent for the youth, who, since he could not conceal the matter, told him the whole story exactly as it had happened.
sentence2: Said the prince: "The whole blame rests on Rose-Red.

sentence1: Said the prince: "The whole blame rests on Rose-Red.
sentence2: I do not reproach you.

sentence1: I do not reproach you.
sentence2: Yet since she is now your wife I will let the whole matter rest.

sentence1: Yet since she is now your wife I will let the whole matter rest.
sentence2: But Molo will have to suffer for it!"

sentence1: But Molo will have to suffer for it!"
sentence2: So he ordered a hundred armored soldiers, with bows and swords, to surround the house of the youth, and under all circumstances to take Molo captive.

sentence1: So he ordered a hundred armored soldiers, with bows and swords, to surround the house of the youth, and under all circumstances to take Molo captive.
sentence2: But Molo drew his dagger and flew up the high wall.

sentence1: But Molo drew his dagger and flew up the high wall.
sentence2: Thence he looked about him like a hawk.

sentence1: Thence he looked about him like a hawk.
sentence2: The arrows flew as thick as rain, but not one hit him.

sentence1: The arrows flew as thick as rain, but not one hit him.
sentence2: And in a moment he had disappeared, no one knew where.

sentence1: And in a moment he had disappeared, no one knew where.
sentence2: Yet ten years later one of his former master's servants ran across him in the South, where he was selling medicine.

sentence1: Yet ten years later one of his former master's servants ran across him in the South, where he was selling medicine.
sentence2: And he looked exactly as he had looked ten years before.
